item.description:
Monthly Challenge: 
Our challenge for this month's meeting is Lights, Camera, Action! This challenge is a bit different than previous challenges in that we need a full three, and exactly three, photos from you. One photo will speak to "lights", a second to "camera", and a third to "action". Bonus points if you tie them all together in a creative way.

Between now and the the meeting, take and email 3 photographs which somehow speak to your interpretation of the subject - please feel free to take great liberty with your interpretation of the subject.

Don't be shy, we have a very encouraging group of critics and we'll all learn something from the experience. Most of all, have fun shooting!

Send monthly challenge photos via email to John. Photos should be JPEGs, no less than 1000 pixels high. A PDF with full details, an FAQ, and email details for the Monthly Challenge is located in the File Library, available to members.

 

But wait there's more...

Brown Bag Bingo - Month 1:
This night will be our first of four swaps in our annual Brown Bag Bingo challenge. Participants should bring their object in a paper lunch bag. At this first meeting, we'll move your object into an official Brown Bag Bingo bag, which is actually white because that's how we roll.

You should also have taken and emailed two photos to John - one reference shot and one creative shot.

If you are not yet participating but would like to, please contact John ASAP, put your object in a paper lunch bag and bring it to the meeting, and email your reference and creative shots to John.

If you want to find out more, read the rules and track the discussion on our Brown Bag Bingo Discussion Board.

 

But wait there's even more...

Monthly Challenges - a Year in Review
We'll take just a bit of time to view the "best of" monthly challenges from the entire year of 2011. Help winnow the photos down to a select few for later presentation.

 

But wait, can you believe it, there's even more than that...

Annual Celebration
As voted at our last meeting, we'll fit in a bit of a celebration this month. We'll supply pizza, soda, wine and beer, and snacks. Much of this will be funded by a monthly contributions surplus, the remainder of which will benefit our sponsor and 501(c)3 charitable art organization, the Seacoast Artists Association.

If you would like to contribute your time, dollars, or food/drink (hint, Thanh, hint), your contribution will be greatly appreciated and rewarded with the love and adoration of your fellow photographers. Especially the hot ones.

 

Location:

We're now meeting at the beautiful Town Hall Gallery building, directly across from the bandstand and Town Hall Offices.

Park on the street or in the nearby municipal lot and walk on over. Walk around the left side of the Town Hall Gallery building (on the side facing the Citizens Bank drive-up windows), and enter the door on the left hand side. Take the elevator to the second floor. Make a left out of the elevator, and enter the room on your left.


Other:
Bring other photos if you'd like feedback or critique, and be prepared to [helpfully] critique others'. It would be preferable to email the photos to John ahead of time so they can be displayed on the screen for all to easily see.

Anything photography- or photographer-related is fair game.
item.how_to_find_us: The gallery is in historic downtown Exeter. The door will be open, come on in.
item.name: Seacoast Photographers Group Monthly Meetup
